intro: Elephantopus erectus, commonly known as the upright elephant's foot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a thick, fleshy stem that resembles an elephant's foot, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. It is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
